titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: We left Durham by the 8.20 express, & arrived in London shortly before 2 p.m. We went directly to the Deanery of S. Paul's.
There dined Pearce & his sister, Sir John & Lady Struthers, Mary, & Linetta. I had contracted a disabling chill, & played well the part of the skeleton at the feast.
